title: 9News Adelaide | Wednesday December 3 | Full Episode
description: Brenton Ragless leads the Adelaide bulletin, with an Adelaide relief teacher who worked at multiple Eastern suburbs schools has been charged with child sex offenses, leaving parents concerned. A fast-food robbery escalated into a massive five-hour siege with armed police in Parafield Gardens. Adelaide publicans are pleading for tougher penalties for repeat violent offenders who are causing chaos and staff fear. Plus, we have the latest on the first extreme fire danger warnings for the season ahead of a hot and windy day. title: 9News Sydney | Wednesday December 3 | Full Episode
description: Peter Overton leads the Sydney bulletin, where Sydney's organised crime network has been dealt a "double blow" after police raids across 12 suburbs seized millions in assets, including luxury cars and weapons. Meanwhile, Bruce Lehrmann's fight to clear his name continues to crumble as he loses his high-stakes appeal against a crushing defamation ruling. The NSW Police Minister, Yasmin Catley, faces embarrassment after her own driver was charged with high-range drink driving. title: 9News Melbourne | Wednesday December 3 | Full Episode
description: Alicia Loxley and Tom Steinfort present the Melbourne news, leading with a Keysborough teacher behind bars after allegedly stabbing his principal, telling police he "mentally snapped" after being told his contract wouldn't be renewed. Meanwhile, a suppression order has lapsed in the High Country killer Greg Lynn case, revealing chilling details about his first wife's troubled final months. In State Parliament, Question Time was interrupted by a protestor who glued herself to the public gallery, while an Ombudsman's report revealed disgraceful messages from staff at the Victorian Managed Insurance Authority (VMIA) regarding Porter Davis collapse victims.
